title: Job Tracker
context: Developed for my Capstone Project course at Oregon State University.
description: Job Tracker is a web application designed to help users manage their job search process. It allows users to track job applications, their skills, and contacts.\nThe application features a user-friendly interface with a dashboard that displays the status of each job application, and a skills dashboard to track how often skills are mentioned in applications.

title: DishFindr
context: Developed for my Software Engineering course at Oregon State University.
description: DishFindr is a web application that allows users to search for recipes based on ingredients they have at home. It provides a user-friendly interface to input ingredients and find matching recipes using the Spoonacular API.\nDishFindr uses a microservices architecture that uses REST APIs to communicate between the main application and three microservices: user-preferences microservice, recipe recommendation microservice, and wine recommendation microservice.

title: Hashmap Data Structure Implementation
context: Developed for my Data Structures course at Oregon State University.
description: I completed the implementation of a hash map using 2 different methods.\nThe first method used is separate chaining where linked lists are used for collision resolution and the underlying structure of the hash table is a dynamic array.\nThe second method used is open addressing with quadratic probing for collision resolution and the underlying structure of the hash table is a dynamic array.
